did.unittitle: IBT Central Conference of Teamsters records

origination.label: source
origination.corpname: International Brotherhood of Teamsters, Chauffeurs, Warehousemen, and Helpers of America

did.abstract: This collection contains correspondence, meeting minutes, calendars, legal documents, personnel files, financial records, programs, brochures, and reports. The material dates from 1957-95.
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site, and may require additional retrieval time. Please contact the Special Collections Research Center for more information.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into 6 series: Administrative Files, Policy Committee Meetings and Agendas, Financial Records, Legal Files, Jurisdiction Disputes, and Area Conference Dissolution.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Within the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, between 1937 and 1995, members of the union met and exchanged ideas on a regional basis. These regional organizations were called Area Conferences. In the U.S. there were four Area Conferences: the Western Conference of Teamsters formed in 1937, the Southern Conference of Teamsters formed in 1944, the Central States Conference of Teamsters formed in 1953, and the Eastern Conference of Teamsters also formed in 1953. Canadian Teamsters had their own Canadian Conference of Teamsters, known today as Teamsters Canada. Area Conferences met annually to discuss general issues facing the IBT and to hold discussion more directly relevant to IBT Trade Divisions: contract negotiations, organizing campaigns, workplace disputes, etc.. For example, when the Central States Conference met, after the general sessions, delegates would meet based on the trades they represented: the brewery and soft drink delegates coming together, cannery delegates coming together, dairy delegates coming together, etc.. In this way, the IBT was strengthened in terms of both national and regional coordination of efforts. The Area Conferences came under criticism during the General Presidency of Ron Carey. Making the argument that they were redundant and wasteful, Carey disbanded them in 1995.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, meeting minutes, calendars, legal documents, personnel files, financial records, programs, brochures, and reports. The material dates from 1957-95. These are the records of the Central Conference of Teamsters, a regional governance body in the structure of the International Brotherhood of Teamsters. The scope of the materials runs from its inception until its dissolution in 1994, the bulk of which are legal and administrative files from the 1970's and 1980's, as well as the controversy regarding the revocation of the charters of the Area Conferences in 1994.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, January 4, 2012 [2012.002].

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the administrative files of the Central Conference of Teamsters from 1990-1994 and includes correspondence, agendas, divisional reports, charters, bylaws, and other files pertaining to the everyday operation of the Central Conference.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains the Minutes and Agendas of the Central Conference of Teamsters Policy Committee, the central administrative authority of the Conference. The materials in this series range from 1983-1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains all financial materials related to the Central Conference of Teamsters, including receipts, bills, financial statements, bank statements, and tax documentation. The materials in this series range in date from 1991 to 1995.

did.unittitle: CCT CSS Benefit Plans A and C

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes legal files collected by the Central Conference of Teamsters from 1973-1995, including cases against the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, cases involving Local Unions, and those involving labor disputes with private organizations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes the collected files of the Central Conference of Teamsters concerning jurisdictional disputes between Local Unions under the aegis of the Central Conference, from 1973-1994.

did.unittitle: Central Conference Of Teamsters Frieght Distributions - Dispute Resolutions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes material leading up to and concerning the revocation of the Area Conference Charters and subsequent dissolution of the Area Conferences within the larger International Brotherhood of Teamsters, from 1992-1994. By the end of 1995, the Central Conference of Teamsters ceased to exist and local unions which were previously a part of the Central Conference fall under the authority of Joint Councils.
